intro: Acmispon strigosus, commonly known as hairy needlepod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces yellow flowers in spring. Acmispon strigosus is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
